|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1cpu = true |rad2chip2 = Atheros;AR2112; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "RT403W-D91 REV2.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The firmware version flashed at the factory is 1.34. The 802.11g radio's MAC address is 1 greater than that of the MAC used by the 802.11a radio. The WAN+LAN ports and the 802.11a radio use the same MAC address. The power adapter included with the device is a '''UNIFIVE CO., LTD.''' AM-US100523 (5V, 2.3A). ==Links of Interest== [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=9395 On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum]
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/WHR-HP-AG108 On the DD-WRT wiki]
[http://wiki.openwrt.org/doku.php?id=oldwiki:openwrtdocs:hardware:buffalo:whr_hp_ag108 On the OpenWrt wiki] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v23 SP2 :[[Buffalo WHR-HP-AG108/dd-wrt|Flashing WHR-HP-AG108]] Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = |wikipage = https://oldwiki.archive.openwrt.org/oldwiki/openwrtdocs/hardware/buffalo/whr_hp_ag108 |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = ? |current_supported_version = ? |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==Pictures==
